And today, there are 80% less children being held in Border Patrol facilities, like the one we saw today, than there were in late March.  

That is incredible progress.

1390775727117807626.text:
This week, 4 families separated under the previous admin were reunited. We saw mothers embrace children they'd been apart from for years. 

As a mom myself, I can imagine no greater gift on Mother’s Day weekend.

1355256904918790144.text: Women are overrepresented in low-wage jobs and underrepresented in high-wage jobs. And even in the jobs where they make up the majority of the workforce, they’re still underpaid relative to men. Women deserve the #PaycheckFairnessAct NOW.

1355253532698546178.text: The Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act, critical as it is, is only one step on the path to ensuring women receive equal pay for equal work. We need the #PaycheckFairnessAct to complete the picture!

1355253531612164101.text: The Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act is a vital law that helps to ensure that individuals subjected to unlawful compensation discrimination are able to have their day in court and effectively assert their rights under federal antidiscrimination laws.

1355253530643329027.text: TODAY is the 12th Anniversary of the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act. On this anniversary, we call for the #PaycheckFairnessAct to be passed!

1355253130087202818.text: In 2020, American women lost more than 5 million jobs. The most recent jobs report shows women account for 100% of the jobs lost in December -- all 140,000 of them. The time for the #PaycheckFairnessAct is NOW!

1355251894583783424.text: Throughout the pandemic, women, particularly moms, have been pushed out of the workforce at alarming numbers as they’ve struggled to juggle their careers with childcare, virtual schooling and caretaking needs for loved ones. That’s why we need the #PaycheckFairnessAct.

We’re going to continue fighting:
🔵 For your healthcare. 
🔵 For economic relief for your families and small businesses. Like the HEROES Act.
🔵 For women’s rights and LGBTQ protections and for protecting Black lives. Like the Justice in Policing Act. 
🔵 And so much more.

1324053944662982659.text:
In fact, the work is really just beginning. We’re weathering the storm of our lifetimes. A pandemic. A sinking economy. 

But I’m going back to Washington, and I’m ready.

1324053943626981376.text: Everything I do in Congress is for you, my constituents. You’re my neighbors and my friends. You’re working folks, young people, immigrants, parents balancing life and work. You are who I’m fighting for. To make your lives a little easier, to make your families stronger.

1309242114002374657.text: Today we #WearOrangeMasks to mark 575 days since the House passed #HR8 and took action to help prevent gun violence. Amid rising gun deaths as people are sheltered at home, McConnnell continues to ignore this life saving bill. Long past time for him to take action. https://t.co/kxCXd4HZDM

1309189677266558976.text: We did it before when we passed the #CARESAct, and we can do it again. /end

1309189675987480579.text: Let’s be honest with ourselves and our constituents: wishful thinking will not end this pandemic. We can’t pretend like it is over. But we can get real relief to families immediately if we stop living in denial and deal with the magnitude of this crisis.

1309189674901082112.text: For the 75 percent of Latinx retirees that depend on Social Security for the majority of their retirement income, maintaining that trust is a matter of survival.

1309189673768628224.text:
Doing so would cut off benefits in just a few years and undermine the central tenet of Social Security. 
❌It is not an entitlement. 
❌It is not a handout. 
✔ It is an earned benefit that every worker pays into. 
✔It is a sacred trust that workers make to their future selves.

1309189672288088065.text: Instead, my colleagues' proposal is to legitimize the president’s dangerous payroll tax deferral. It would be the first step toward doing away with Social Security’s dedicated funding altogether. The president has said he wants to eliminate the payroll tax numerous times.

1309189671247904768.text:
A good place to start would be extending the full $600 federal unemployment benefit. 

And we should give families additional economic impact payments so they can keep their heads above water. 

We passed this assistance in the House ** more than four months ago **.

1309189670312587264.text: What good is a payroll tax cut when you don’t have the ability to earn a paycheck? There are countless more effective ways we can help families right now, and we can do so without undermining Social Security’s dedicated revenue stream.

1309189669398237184.text: Families need real help, and they need it now. Instead, all they got was a cut to their unemployment benefits and a payroll tax deferral that no one asked for. If it weren’t a matter of life and death, deferring taxes on nonexistent or sharply reduced wages would be laughable.

1309189668483760129.text: And the countless Latinx workers in higher wage sectors still face pay disparities that result in lower lifetime earnings than their white counterparts. As a result, every Latinx worker’s contribution to Social Security is all the more critical to their retirement.

1309189667414253568.text: They put themselves in harm’s way on a daily basis while the rest of our community is hurting from higher rates of layoffs and reduced wages. That’s because Latinx workers also make up a disproportionate share of the labor force in industries most affected by the pandemic.

1309186836267491328.text:
I'm testifying at a @WaysMeansCmte hearing on #SocialSecurity. 

The COVID-19 pandemic has hurt every community in our country. But it has hit some far harder than others. The essential labor force is disproportionately made up of Latinx workers. /thread

1309183730095927296.text:

🍎🍏 Our communities need teachers.

.@rosadelauro and I first introduced the #WICAct in 2015. We are proud to have the support of @NatWICAssoc and will keep up the fight to improve this vital program.

1260956553617833985.text: This improvement to the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children program is *especially* needed now as many schools across the country remain closed and children have a harder time obtaining free school meals.

1260956552271474688.text: Access to proper nutrition is critical to the health and development of children. By increasing the WIC age limit from five to six, we would close a crucial gap for kids who turn six before entering kindergarten and becoming eligible for school meals.

1260956550883086340.text: This week, my colleagues @RepKimSchrier, & @RepJenniffer joined @rosadelauro and me in reintroducing the Wise Investment in Children Act. The #WICAct would extend the eligibility for children to participate in the WIC program until their sixth birthday.

3/ Did you cash it?
🔹Submit a personal check or money order to the IRS (below).
🔹Make it payable to “U.S. Treasury” and write "2020EIP" + the taxpayer identification # of the recipient of the check.
🔹Include a brief explanation of the reason for returning the EIP.

1258502074607849476.text:
2/ Did you receive a paper check?
🔹Write "Void" in the endorsement section on the back.
🔹Mail the voided check immediately to the IRS (below).
🔹Don't staple, bend, or paper clip the check.
🔹Include a note stating the reason for returning the check.
